head.title: PSA Shares Drop in Mistaken-Identity Case

hedline.hl1: PSA Shares Drop in Mistaken-Identity Case

abstract.p: Share price of PSA Inc plunges after it is confused with privately held firm with same name in report by Dow Jones New Service; new service reported that PSA filed for bankruptcy, but later stated that it was different PSA company; graph (S)

block.p: Sometimes two companies can have the same name, and sometimes news services can make mistakes.

Shares in PSA Inc., an aspiring broadband services company based in Los Angeles, trade on the over-the-counter bulletin board under the ticker symbol PSAX, usually in low volume. By 12:10 p.m. yesterday, 2,500 shares had traded, and the price had risen 6 cents, to $4.94.
Sometimes two companies can have the same name, and sometimes news services can make mistakes.

Shares in PSA Inc., an aspiring broadband services company based in Los Angeles, trade on the over-the-counter bulletin board under the ticker symbol PSAX, usually in low volume. By 12:10 p.m. yesterday, 2,500 shares had traded, and the price had risen 6 cents, to $4.94.
Then the Dow Jones News Service reported that PSA Inc. had filed for bankruptcy. The report listed its ticker symbol as PSAX.

The sell orders soon poured in, and by 12:35 the share price had fallen to $1.75, or 65 percent less than the price before the report. At 12:42, Dow Jones corrected the report, saying that the company that filed for bankruptcy was a different PSA Inc. That PSA is an unrelated, privately held company, Dow Jones said.
By the end of the day, the publicly traded PSA shares had recovered to $4.19, down 69 cents for the day. Volume came to 213,700 shares, or more than had traded in the last three weeks combined.
